meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a virus that can infect cells of a species other than the one from which it originated.
meanings.sent1: The xenotropic virus spread quickly among the diverse animals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the xenotropic properties of the virus to understand its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The xenotropic virus decided to take a vacation in the neighboring zoo.
meanings.sent4: The xenotropic nature of the virus allowed it to cross boundaries effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The xenotropic virus was like a curious traveler exploring new territories.

meanings.definition: Capable of infecting cells of a different species.
meanings.sent1: The xenotropic cells showed remarkable adaptability in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Researchers were amazed by the xenotropic abilities of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The xenotropic cells threw a party in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were xenotropic, influencing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The xenotropic capabilities of the virus were both fascinating and concerning.
